alert.note: Alert for Maryland Beaches (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 30 at 2:33AM EDT until October 01 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High rip current risk. * WHERE...In Maryland, Maryland Beaches. In Virginia, Accomack County. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents.. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. OCEAN CITY INLET MD MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.0 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.5 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/09 AM 3.9 1.4 0.8 1 NONE 30/10 PM 4.0 1.5 1.1 1 MINOR 01/10 AM 3.8 1.3 0.7 1 NONE 01/10 PM 3.3 0.8 0.6 1 NONE 02/11 AM 3.7 1.2 0.6 1 NONE 02/11 PM 3.0 0.5 0.5 1 NONE SAXIS VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
